results.title: Beaches and boats
results.creator_credit: Western Australian Government Film Unit, Norman A. Uren and Leith Goodall
results.brief_description: This film depicts the beauty of Western Australia’s beaches and the lifestyle that can be enjoyed there. Sandy beaches stretch along the West Australian coast for hundreds of miles, providing an ideal place for a holiday of boating, water-skiing, surfboard riding, and sunbathing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Western Australian Government Film Unit, Norman A. Uren and Leith Goodall

results.title: Beaches (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Silver Screen Partners IV, Bruckheimer, South, Bonnie Bruckheimer, Bette Midler, Margaret Jennings South and Garry Marshall
results.brief_description: The chance meeting of two young girls from totally different backgrounds becomes the friendship of a lifetime. As they lead their separate lives, they come to realise and later rely on the strength that their friendship provides. Cast includes Bette Midler, Barbara Hershey and John Heard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Touchstone Pictures, Silver Screen Partners IV, Bruckheimer, South, Bonnie Bruckheimer, Bette Midler, Margaret Jennings South and Garry Marshall

results.title: Beach story
results.brief_description: A family spends the day at the beach. The tensions between mother, daughter and father lead all three characters to isolate themselves as much as they can from each other - creating interior worlds within the larger open expanse of sand, surf, sand and horizon. This intimate and elegantly executed short film is a moving examination of one seemingly ordinary day that will change the dynamics of the family for all time.

results.title: Beach and sea animals: an instructional sound film
results.brief_description: A survey of typical beach and sea animals in their natural surroundings, showing in particular their inter-relationships and methods of self-protection.

results.title: Beach
results.brief_description: Multi-layered interactive work using both still and moving images of Bells Beach, Point Addis and a beach cave. A beautifully constructed meditative piece accompanied by the sounds of nature.

results.title: Be well: physical fitness in the later years
results.brief_description: This film shows a variety of ways in which older people can stay physically active, or even start exercising regularly for the first time in their lives. Seniors who have incorporated such physical activities into their daily routines are living proof of the rewards.

results.title: Be water wise
results.brief_description: This film discusses basic aspects of water safety, emphasizing the proper method for floating and treading water and the proper procedure for rescue operations. No other credits available.

results.title: Be prepared
results.brief_description: Discussion starter looking at the necessity for preparation in a group information session. Steve arrives late and is ill-prepared for his demonstration of a new slogan. His equipment fails, he is interrupted by workmen and he loses his audience. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Be clean and healthy
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films and Langton Gould-Marks
results.brief_description: Contrasts healthy children at play with a boy who is “out of everything” because of ill health. Shows simple rules for the care of the body, including the hair and teeth, how to dress comfortably, what to eat, and how to care for eating utensils.
